Source code for inferlycore.data.data

from dataclasses import dataclass

import pandas as pd



[docs]@dataclass
class Dataset:
    """Main class for handling datasets.

    Args:
        dataframe (pandas dataframe): Dataframe containing the data.
        input_names (list of strings): Name of the columns associated with input variables.
        output_names (list of strings): Name of the columns associated with output variables.

    Attributes:
        input_names (list of strings): value passed at construction.
        output_names (list of strings): value passed at construction.
        data (pandas DataFrame): n x input_dim dataframe
    """

    data: pd.DataFrame
    input_names: list[str]
    output_names: list[str]

    def __post_init__(self):
        """Check consisency of the inputs provided."""
        for name in self.input_names + self.output_names:
            if name not in self.data.columns:
                raise ValueError(f"variable '{name}' not found in dataset")




[docs]def train_test_split(dataset: Dataset, n_train: int, random_state: int = None) -> tuple[Dataset, Dataset]:
    """Split a dataset into a training and test set.

    Args:
        dataset (Dataset): Dataset to split.
        n_train (int): number of points to keep for training.
        random_state (int): Seed for the random number generator.

    Returns:
        train_set (Dataset): Training set with n_train entries.
        test_set (Dataset): Test set with remaining entries.
    """
    train_data = dataset.data.sample(n_train, random_state=random_state)
    test_data = dataset.data.drop(train_data.index)
    train_set = Dataset(train_data, dataset.input_names, dataset.output_names)
    test_set = Dataset(test_data, dataset.input_names, dataset.output_names)
    return train_set, test_set
